page.title: 10Housing in Kensworth Area
page.content: Whipsnade is an unspoiled village of about 40 houses varying in ages,some dating from the 15th Century.No recent development has been allowed.About 12 houses are occupied by zoo workers, there are 6 local authority homes,the remainder being private.There is a mobile home park of 120 units. Kensworth is a sprawling mixture of council and private houses forming a ribbon development along the B4540. Some timber framed houses date back to the 15th Century.The most recent are two developments of private and council houses to the S.West of the main road. Other residential areas are Oldhill Wood in Whipsnade Parish consisting of 60 houses and bungalows. Holywell Rd.,Oakway,& Woodland Rise in Studham Parish were first established in the 1930's but have grown considerably in the last ten years.
